Appendix 5   
 
PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
1.  Madhya Pradesh (MP) Transco and distribution companies (DISCOMs) have prepared 
detail project proposal (DPR), outlining the requirements of new transmission and distribution 
assets, and their cost estimates. The DPR has been approved by the MP Energy Department 
and submitted for approval of the Ministry of Power of the Central government and Department 
of Economic Affairs (DEA). However, the depth and coverage of technical justification, and 
financial, and economic analyses of the DPR is inadequate to meet the Asian Development 
Bank (ADB) standards of project due diligence. The analyses presented by the transmission 
and distribution companies need to be critically reviewed and updated.  Moreover, social and 
environmental  safeguards  are  not  covered  in the  DPR,  and  additionally,  a  detailed  sector 
analysis is required to meet the ADB requirements. The project preparatory technical assistance 
(PPTA) resources will be used to conduct these additional analyses and prepare the project 
documents for ADB approval. 
 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities 
2.  The main output of the PPTA will be a project feasibility report which include: (i) MP 
power sector assessment (ii) updated problem tree analysis and DMF; (iii) project description 
and detailed cost estimates; (iv) economic and financial analyses; and (v) initial environmental 
examinations (IEEs), environmental management plans (EMPs), and resettlement plans (RPs). 
Outputs also include a feasibility report on solar irrigation in MP and a presentation on solar 
irrigation to Ministry of Power and DEA.1

1  Solar irrigation is a potential area for future interventions in India. Currently the Government of India spends an 
estimated $20 billion power subsidy for irrigation. Agricultural water pumping is a major cause of system instability 
and power subsidies for agriculture is a major reason for poor financial performance of DISCOMs. Replacing the 
grid connected and diesel pumps with solar powered pumps improve system stability and cost recovery, and help 
mitigating climate change. It also avoids local air pollution.  Therefore solar irrigation is an integral part of the longe 
term solution to power sector problems in India.  Small amount of resources of the PPTA is allocated to 
systematically examine the feasibility of solar irrigation in India with the view to engage government on a dialogue 
to open up future ADB interventions.

6.  The outline terms of references for the project preparatory TA consultants are described 
in paras. 7 to 13.  
 
7.  Power  System  Engineer/Team  Leader  (international  4  person-months,  national  4 
person  months).  The  International  consultant  should  have  a  higher  degree  in  electrical 
engineering together with 10 years of experience in energy sector project development. The

national expert should have similar qualifications with 5 years of experience. The international 
power system development specialist and team leader should have served as a team leader, 
preferably in ADB projects in the past. The international power system development specialist 
and team leader, with the assistance from national consultant, will be responsible for the overall 
quality  and  implementation  of  the  TA  assignment,  providing  the  required  support  for  the 
executing  agency  and  reporting  to  ADB’s  project  officer.  With  the  national  power  system 
development specialist, as well as other consultant team members, the international power 
system  development  specialist  and  team  leader  will  provide  technical  and  management 
expertise in the application engineering expertise and undertake all the required technical due 
diligence  in selecting the development of priority investment projects in power transmission, 
distribution. The team leader also should review the reports by other consultants to ensure 
consistency and quality.  
 
8.  Financial Specialist (international 3 person-months, national 3 person-months). The 
international financial specialist should have an advanced degree in a relevant field, preferably 
in finance or engineering, and 8 years of field experience on financial assessment of energy 
projects and/or energy utilities. The national expert should have similar qualifications with 5 
years of experience.  In accordance with ADB’s Guidelines for the Financial Analysis and 
Management of Projects (2005), the Financial Management Assessment Questionnaire (2005), 
and the Financial Due Diligence Methodology Note (2005), the International Financial Analyst 
will  undertake  financial  analysis  of  the  proposed  investment  components  and  assess  the 
financial performance and the financial management capabilities of the executing/implementing 
agencies, with assistance of the national financial analyst. Working in collaboration with the 
Project Economists to ensure the use of consistent approach and assumptions across the 
financial and economic analyses, the financial analysts will  undertake all the analytical work 
necessary to justify the financial viability of the project and financial sustainability of the power 
sector companies. 
 
9.  Environmental Specialist (international 4 person-months, national 4 person-months). 
International Environment Specialist should have an advanced degree in science, engineering 
or environment management together with 8 years of experience in undertaking environment 
impact assessment in power projects. National expert should have similar qualifications with 5 
years of field experience. In accordance with ADB’s Safeguard Policy Statement (2009) and 
other  relevant  guideline  documents  for  environmental  assessment,  the  international 
environmental specialist, with assistance of the national environmental specialist will undertake,  
rapid environment assessment and project categorization, preparation of IEE/EIA, including 
environment management plan and undertake consultation to meet the ADB requirement as 
specified in the Environment Policy Statement of 2009.  
 
10.  Social Safeguard/Development Specialist (international 4 person months, national 4 
person-months). The international social development specialist should have a higher degree in 
a relevant field, preferably in Social Sciences, together with 8 years of experience in social 
impact assessment and preparation of resettlement plans. The national expert should have 
similar qualifications with 5 years of field experience. In accordance with all relevant policies, in 
particular with the relevant laws and policies of India and ADB’s Safeguard Policy Statement 
(2009) the tasks of the international social development specialist, with assistance of national 
social  development  specialist  will  undertake  social  safeguard  due  diligence  including 
categorization  of  the  project  for  indigenous  peoples  and  involuntary  resettlement,  prepare 
resettlement plan, poverty and social and gender analysis to meet the requirements of the ADB 
safeguard  policy  statement  of  2009.  The  expert  should  also  examine  whether  there  is  a 
potential for up scaling the ongoing gender activities of the MP energy efficiency improvement 
investment program.

11.  Project  Economist  (international  3  person-months,  national  3  person-months)  The 
candidate should have an advanced degree in engineering, economics or energy economics 
together with 8 years of experience in energy sector project evaluation. The national expert 
should  have  similar  qualifications  with  5  years  of  experience.  In  accordance  with  ADB’s 
Guidelines for the Economic Analysis of Projects, the international energy economist, with 
assistance  of  the  national  economist,  will  undertake  economic  analysis  of  the  proposed 
investment  components  and  assess  their  economic  viability  following  ADB’s  guidelines  for 
undertaking project economic analyisis. Economist will work in collaboration with the financial 
analysts to ensure the use of consistent approach and assumptions across the financial and 
economic analyses.  
 
12   Economist/Solar Irrigation,  (International  2  person-months). The  consultant  should 
have a higher degree, preferably a Ph.D. in natural resource economics with 10 years of 
professional  experience.  Previous  experience  in  cost  benefit  analysis  of  solar  irrigation 
incorporating environment benefits is an added qualification. Working in collaboration with the 
energy specialists in the project team the consultant will carry technical and economic feasibility 
of solar irrigation and undertake a cost benefit analysis incorporating environmental benefits of 
solar irrigation. 
 
13.  Financial Specialist/Solar Irrigation (international 1 person-month). The consultant 
should  have  a  higher  degree,  in  finance  or  engineering  with  10  years  of  professional 
experience. In collaboration with the solar irrigation economist and the rest of the team, the 
consultant will assess the technical feasibility of replacement of diesel and grid connected water 
pumps with solar powered pumps; review ADB’s intern report on the subject and improve the 
financial analysis of that report incorporating MP as a case study; develop financing models for 
MP and India to replace grid connected and diesel solar pump with solar irrigated pumps using 
avoided subsidies as source of financing.  
 
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
14.  Department of Energy, government of MP will be the executing and the implementing 
agency of the PPTA.  Department of Energy will provide in-kind contributions in the form of 
office space for the consultants, allocating counterpart staff, and other in kind support.
